<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dragon Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=5977) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=701" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 118 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 4), [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=255) (Level 4)

**Requirements**
You are unarmored.

</column>

---

You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon's tail. You can make dragon tail attacks that deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. They are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group and have the [backswing](/Traits.aspx?ID=545), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) traits.

 While in Dragon Stance, you can ignore the first square of [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) while Striding.

<title level="2">Dragon Stance leads to...</title>
[Dragon Roar](/Feats.aspx?ID=6001)
name: Dragon Stance
